name: SanctuaryRPG: Black Edition
description: SanctuaryRPG: Black Edition is a humorous and strategic turn-based dungeon crawling ASCII adventure. Drawing heavy inspiration from both Roguelikes and Japanese RPGs, the game offers a robust action-RPG inspired combat system.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP Processor: 1.0 GHz Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: Integrated Graphics Storage: 200 MB available space Sound Card: Integrated Audio Additional Notes: Toaster-Compatible! (But not really)

reviews.review_text: If you played any door games in the past, such as Trade Wars, Legend of the Red Dragon, Tele-Arena, and various other games played on BBSes, or later MUDs in the beginning of the internet, then do yourself a favor, and buy this right now, you don't need to read further.  I'm such a person. I played lots of door games, had a BBS myself, and been active on various BBSes for a good number of years, starting with a 2400 baud modem and going all the way up to 56k, then broadband.  I saw SanctuaryRPG suggested to me, and as soon as I saw the store video, saying this was Steam's first ASCII game, and saw the very nice ASCII graphics indeed, I was sold instantly. I didn't looked up the reviews, nor checked the forums, I didn't even expanded the more info on the game. I just bought it.   So when I tried it, I had the biggest surprise of my life... this game is pure genius. Only with a text game you could come up with such a brilliant, deep, very deep, combat system. Yeah, you heard me right, this text game has better combat than all graphic games out there. And yet, you see nothing of the combat itself. I won't spoil it, but it's real good.  Don't be fooled, its no rogue-like in the common sense, you aren't a letter on a grid, and move one square at a time, with enemy moving after you. This is played more like traditional door games. Not MUDs tho. You don't move with directions. The rogue part is the permadeath, tho you can play softcore. But I highly recommend you play the way its intended, classic with permadeath.  The chip tunes soundtrack is very good and totally fit the game.   I'm currently the owner of a tavern, serve drinks to customers, entertain them by smashing potatos on top of my head, amongst various other things, and sometimes they give me a gift, or leave :)   Still reading? Go buy it now!

First-up, what really stands-out is the way the game offers JUST the right amount of guidance and has JUST the right amount of encouragement - you do have some reading to do but it's always just the amount of content you need - which is important cos there's lots to take-in.  I've enjoyed-the-hell out of this thusfar - my only real complaint would be that it's perfect tablet material but control system which kinda requires a whole keyboard and there's no many ways around that...  If you like the look of it - the odds are you'll like the game more tho - and there's a DEMO so, chop chop, try it!!

ASCII is not for everyone. Bat as an RPG this really works and the multiplayer pvp element is satisfying too. If you are mature enough to see past the graphics or if you yearn over memories of the old MUD scene then there are hundreds of hours for you here. Insanely addictive and, once again, highlights that graphics don't mean squat if you have some decent gameplay. Really nice.
I got up to level 35, got killed in one hit, cried.

This is a great RPG. It's played entirely with the keyboard, with the interface, events, characters, and items all drawn in ASCII art. Try the free demo on their site, and then imagine how there's 10 times more content. I went from demo to the Black Edition, and I was blown away by the amount of content added, and I don't wanna ruin that for everyone, so I'll just say that I recommend it to anyone who likes RPG/Roguelikes with goofy humor and doesn't mind playing playing entirely with the keyboard.

Alright I managed to trigger an event...  Met a strange Hobo 1 Say Hello 2 Stab Her 3 Steal her weapon 4 Roll away  As a normal human being i choose to Say Hello  You said Hello  She Stabs me...  10/10 Best game ever

The silly cousin of Diablo made with ascii art and a epic soundtrack. That sounds pretty awesome and trust me, it is!  SanctuaryRPG is a game envisioned and programmed by a single person. You start of this game creating a character. Selecting between various races/classes/weapon styles and more. After that you'll select between hardcore mode (die once and you lose your character) or casual mode. Then your adventure starts into this wacky ascii world filled with enemy encounters, silly dialogue and lot of random loot. Just like in Diablo you will get that feeling of glee when you find another epic or even legendary piece of equipment.  Graphicly the game is .. text based. I grew up past the whole textbased era of games but for it only being text it looks good. For me it doesn't add or detract anything to the game.  The music is a great feature of this game. Every tune just fits the scene. For example the blacksmith theme has a blacksmith hammer clanging with the tune and it sounds awesome. There are a lot of various battle themes (all of them sound great) which is important because you will be battling 80% of your time in the game.  One of the things I disliked about the game was how you lose all progress when you die. Ofcourse that's normal in a roguelike game, but deaths can be very random and the game isn't short. I got past act 1 on a 2,5 hour play session, was feeling very strong only to die by a random encounter. After you restart you get the slow unlocking of abilities and story arc again and they are the same every time, so that can get a bit tedious.  I haven't finished the game yet, don't know if I ever will (random stuff can and will kill you eventually, it seems) but what I have played so far is a lot of fun and I can feel the passion that creators have put into this project.

Theody, the Classic Lvl 170 Medium Male Human Marauder ===== You have been conclusively BESTED at Lvl 170 by a Demon. In 15 hours and 11 minutes, you've killed 660 enemies. Your 'Lawful Stuck-Up' life has been archived. ===== VIT: 1116 STR: 1221 INT: 3 DEX: 199 WIS: 146 =====    in loving memory

Pros:  - Awesome combat - Expansive story - Lots of humor - Plenty of content - Unique look - Great music  Cons:  - Perma-death  This game is amazing, there is so much to do, some many enemies to fight, and lots of laughs to be had. You will love this game until you are defeated by an enemy and realize you have to start at square one, no matter how much time you have put into your character. I think some games are fine with perma-death, but this game isn't one of those games. SanctuaryRPG is way too big and expansive to have perma-death. I know that there is a softcore mode, but that mode makes it way too easy as their is very little punishment for dying contrary to what the mode description says. I would give this game a 9/10 or maybe even 10/10 if it wasn't for the permanant death. I'll still reccomend this game because there is still a lot of fun to be had, just be ready to lose everything when you die in SanctuaryRPG.  6/10

I haven't gotten too far into this game but I'm enjoying it very much. The ASCII presentation reminds me of old dial-up BBS door games, but the story and combat go beyond arcadey games like those. Combat is a strategic balance of managing your resources (damage, health, mana, debuffs) while whittling away at your foe. Combat is combo-based and you're rewarded for long chains of attacks which tempt you into fighting without healing. Permadeath makes the game more exciting since it encourages you to take risks.  Quite a deep game despite the deceptively simplistic presentation. Very compelling and detailed, plus it's got a sense of humour. Great game!

For an ASCII game, Sanctuary RPG is easy to understand, accommodating to any player base, very funny, with an engaging story. It is short, and lacks a bit of replayability, but overall definitely worth a try this Steam Sale season!
I KEEP TELLING MYSELF I WILL BEAT THIS GAME ON LUNATIC MODE  I KEEP TELLING MYSELF THIS

This game has extremely good graphics.They might be nothing like actual graphics,they're so well managed it makes the game beautiful,and I don't think I'd enjoy it as much with a graphical upgrade  The content is very wide,with tons of different classes/races/perks/etc to try, and very in-depth mechanics on every choices you make.  The combat mechanic first looks like you just need to spam '1 2 3 3 1 2 3 3' all over again, but once you reach New Game + and go into Inferno, you'll need to learn how to use the combat mechanics and will see that they are actually very well made and in depth.  Crafting mechanics are pretty boring and grindy, but it still is a plus to be able to craft and retrieve crafting materials  In short,awesome RPG for every potatoes out there.
This was the game I needed all along
If you were born in the late 1980's this game will suck you helplessly into the void. Prepare to lose track of time real bad. 11/10
Stabbed myself with a potato. 10/10 Would potato again.
addictive af
simple fun and addicting

I've only played for a bit, and haven't advanced much into it, but so far I'm loving it. This is the first ASCII rpg I've played, so a lot of the things I like probably just go with the genre.    Options  'You wanna go over there? Sure Oh lookie, a stone! You... want to eat it? Sure I guess.. Whoops, looks like that wasn't so good!' You get loads of minor choices when playing, most are irrelevant, but they're very entertaining :)   Complex  The system is more complex than I thought it would be. This means the first few runs will mostly be of learning the game mechanics and reading, reading tons of info about what how when everything. Once you start getting the hang of it though all speeds up.   Brutal  About speeding it up... you have to watch out, the game can be brutal and one-shoot you before you realise what happened. Learning how to tweak your stats and how to pace the story progression is vital. And this is just in normal mode.   Music  Great variation of animated bit-like tunes. Tons of sound effects for the different actions/events.   OS  As of this review the game is only available for windows. But good news! It works flawlessly with wine :)   Overall  If you like rogues, buy it, it's that simple. If you get frustrated easily or are quick give up then this might not be the game for you.
NO SWEDISH   PEODIPEI NOT UNDERSTAND
very very addicting game, just like the older rpg's but even better!
A fun game to play!
Became friends with many potatoes  Taste better than french fries.
Witty humor, fun, easy paced gameplay. Whats not to love? Besides potatoes that is.

It's surprisingly not at all boring for an ASCII game. I played it quite a bit before it came out on Steam, and I couldn't resist grabbing it once it came here. Fun, hilarious, keeps you wondering what's gonna happen next. Lots of replayability too. Get it you potato
This game taught me a lot about potatoes.
opened a book i found in a cave and died.   11/10.
Like Darksouls but actually good and without the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t deaths.
After around 10 hours - I actually rage quit, for good. Still well worth the 2 bucks I paid.
Grandest of Games.   Grand
cool

GREAT GAME  This game is excellent. The music is excellent. The graphics are excellent, the ascii art is just fantastic. The gameplay is fun. The game is very humerous, I encountered a wolf who proceeded to vomit on me, but I destroyed him, only recieving a graze to the crotch. Yes, it says stuff like that. The dialoge with the various characters, the quests and events are all well done and can be quite funny. This game is gr8 m8, 88/88 10/10 would buy again There is just nothing else like it. Good for fans of more old school rpg's.

Despite being a fan of retro games, I was a bit hesitant when deciding whether or not I should get this game. I'm glad I ended up buying it; it's a great game. The battles are tense, and it truly replicates the old PC games I've played before.  If you're even slightly interested in this, just get it. You won't regret it.

This game is the easiest and hardest text advetunre I've ever played. It's easy in the fact that things are pretty straight forward. You don't have to type 'Go West' Inspect Object' or figure out the write combination of recognized words to make an action happen. It's very streamlined to pressing certain keys on the board.   The hard part is surviving and winning. Ugh! It's like 0-60 in a matter of minutes. One minute you're feeling pretty good about defeating enemies and the next you're screaming obsenities because that enemy just killed you even though you had more than half your health, all because it blinded you, froze you, and made it so you could use one attack and oh whoops, that one just so happened to be the one that lets you regain health.  Or maybe I just suck. I dunno. Anyway, it's a fantastic game and you should definitely give it a shot if you're looking for something old but new to play.   P.S. The music is great, the art is great and I LOVE the randomly generated back story. I've saved every single one. :)

This is a really nice game. The combat system is well-thought out and makes you pay attention, but doesn't punish you too harshly. The craft system is cool - how you craft the item determines how good it is. You can't farm raw materials easily so it makes you want to focus on each craft to make the best item you can get. Randomized dungeons, treasure chests, running your own tavern, this game seems to have it all.
Warning: This game is EXTREMELY addictive!

I wasn't sure I was going to enjoy the game based on the videos and gameplay I saw, but I read some reviews and given it's low price, I thought 'what do I have to lose?'  Knowing what I know now about this game, I definitely would have payed $19.99 for it. It's wonderful. The characters are unique and witty, the combat system is intricate and dynamic and forces you to adapt to each opponent and not rely on a single spell you can spam to win. The storyline is interesting and focused and the dungeon and quest line isn't boring or detracting from the main plot. This isn't a 'grind until you win' type of game, and even if it is, I can't say I noticed.  Plus, the music is awesome. And potatoes. If you don't like potatoes, don't even try.

Killed the Matron no problem with my level 80 Barbarian. Now I'm in Act 4 and I get a little cocky and decide to explore a building with 1 hp (having been damaged on my last exploration attempt) I get killed by a Skeleton and die. Didn't think you could die while exploring but I guess you can lol. Now I'm left wondering if there's anything after the Matron? I fought the elemental things for a while but it seemed endless. If someone has gotten further please let me know :)  After dying at a high level and investing a good 15 hours into that character, I wondered if I should play again to 'finish the game'. I decided to play it again, that's how addicting this game is!

Downloaded the demo for this thinking, 'Oh it's yet another dungeon-crawling roguelike. I'll try it out but I'm sure I'll get bored of it soon.' After nearly 5 hours of playtime on just the demo, I grudgingly (and happily) have to admit that I couldn't be more wrong. This is an interesting and excellent game that reminds me of what would happen if Zork, Aniwey's CandyBox, and Kingdom of Loathing made a freaky three-way lovechild that has a bizarre obsession with potatoes.   PROS + Fun and engaging retro-esque gameplay + Demands your attention during battle, unlike a lot of turn-based RPGs where you can just autoattack your way to victory + Quirky and goofy sense of humor + Really good music + Potatoes  WASHES = Challenging and punishing, like most roguelikes seem to be. I find this enjoyable personally but be warned! = ASCII graphics. I don't mind much personally since they're fairly well done, but YMMV.  CONS - Heavy RNG reliance and it often bites you in the butt (example: I'm playing a Paladin. One of the class 'perks' is you deal 25% less damage unless you have a Heavy shield. After about 2 hours into the game, I've found dozens of Light and Medium shields but no Heavy!) - Pretty dense information-wise, definitely has a bit of a learning curve. Doesn't help that the official wiki is pretty sparse on some details.   On the whole: Extremely engaging for any dungeon crawler looking to delve back into the 'good old days' with a little text-based romp. Very, very good for the price.

I wasn't sure I was going to enjoy the game based on the videos and gameplay I saw, but I read some reviews and given it's low price, I thought 'what do I have to lose?'  Knowing what I know now about this game, I definitely would have payed $19.99 for it. It's wonderful. The characters are unique and witty, the combat system is intricate and dynamic and forces you to adapt to each opponent and not rely on a single spell you can spam to win. The storyline is interesting and focused and the dungeon and quest line isn't boring or detracting from the main plot. This isn't a 'grind until you win' type of game, and even if it is, I can't say I noticed.  Plus, the music is awesome. And potatoes. If you don't like potatoes, don't even try.

ACTUALLY REALLY GOOD!  You start out slow but as time goes you ease in to it. After an hour you're already invested in the game and don't mind playing for some more.  It lets your fantasy run wild, even though some ASCII art is shown most is up to you, to imagine.   NOSTALGIA TRIP isn't at all out of place here, text based adventure game.   Pros: IT'S ASCII LAPTOP FIRENDLY REPLAY VALUE IMAGINATION  Cons: TAKES A WHILE TO GET IN TO A LOT OF TEXT WEIRD SCALING ISSUES  Would definitely pick this up on sale
Do you like potatoes? So does this game. There are even potatoes in the game. Are they useful? No, it's fakin potato. But it is still a potato.  10/10 I like potatoes.

I absolutely adore this game. I never thought I would have so much fun with this genre of game. Had an absolute blast with it.   The story was pretty damn good, the combat was brilliant, really punishes you if you do not pay attention. In fact, the game punishes you if you do not pay attention whatsoever. Loved the humorous 'hints' that you came across before battles and the things the characters would say.    Finally beat The Matron on my fourth or fifth try. My heart was beatin', my hands were shakin' but I got through it.   Anyone that is after a text based/ASCII RPG game, this is the one for you.
I was a level 77 Ravager making my way through Classic mode in Act IV. I choked on a banana peel and died, wasting 7 hours of work.  10/10, would play again.
Oh man. A true text-based adventure. Great soundtrack and a lot of fun murderingt ASCII monsters.

Holy crap - you guys managed to make a game with ASCII graphics BETTER than most expensive, 3D rendered RPGS that I have played. Huge amount of death, just the right amount of difficulty...really, well done.  Got this game on a reddit giveaway, and I can tell I am going to invest a lot of time into it.

If you want to play really Hardcore RPG game, this is what you seek for! 300 levels, cool plot, really low minimum requirements (!) and TONS of dead heroes and restarts!!! But there is only one minus - game developers launch Steam achievements asap)))
Shasha would be proud of this game.
amazing soundtrack its too awsome to say anything else

If you're not a friend of the potato, then this game just might not be the right one for you (although you'd miss the chance to sacrifice some at the altar). If, on the other hand, you're up for some absurdity like rubbing yourself with said potatoes for entertainment or slapping a pickle in your face, then this game should be your top one priority. Not even 20 minutes in and you'll be laughing your ♥♥♥♥ off.  That said, it's quite a witty and complex thing, this game, and really is worth its price.

I think my favorite part about this game is that I can play it at work and no one really knows I am playing a video game. Aside from that, it's a pretty challenging rogue like that I think MUD/Turn-based RPG fans would enjoy. The humor is also great, especially during the character creation portion of the game.
One of the best rougue-like I have played in years.
Praise the Great Potato

//I got this game through humble bundle. I wanna point that out real quick. Ok, continue//  This game presents me with loads of PTSD from my hours with Zork but here; you're given s o m e t h i n g to project unto. SRPG is an ASCII game that's part rougelike, part RPG, part DND, and part 'magic is still the best' It gives you a story it does, but it also allows you to go exploring in the various areas you walk through. Its also got a sense of humor, which is nearly suprising but I couldn't tell you why.  Its really really hard on the eyes and presents you with walls of text to try to pick through. Kinda like my reviews. The music is music. Its not incredible, The graphics are ASCII and are moderatly impressive, if only because I could'nt manage to do it.  Good luck trying to figure out how much acid it takes to get the 'blue slime' to actually look like what a slime would look like. ASCII isn't the best for amorphous blobs like that. Faces look really silly to me but that's really not the point.   Should you get this game? Yes. Experience it. Don't play it with a headache though.  7/10

This game proves you don't have to have ultra realistic graphics to be a great game. Most fun I have had playing a game in forever. The game has amazing pacing and a the right amount of hints/tutorials to keep you hooked without overloading you with options.  Highly recommend this to anyone that is a fan of turn based RPGs.  10/10

This game proves you don't have to have ultra realistic graphics to be a great game. Most fun I have had playing a game in forever. The game has amazing pacing and a the right amount of hints/tutorials to keep you hooked without overloading you with options.  Highly recommend this to anyone that is a fan of turn based RPGs.  10/10
If you played MuDZ of any kind this is a nice throwback to that time.  Also you can wrassle a dragon naked.

[FIRST IMPRESSIONS]  I didn't think I'd like it as much as I do now. At first glance it appears to be archaic and generic... but it's not! The mechanics that are used are superbly designed and allows for a deeper tactical experience than your typical JRPG/Rougelike. The controls are surprisingly fluid (for what kind of game this is) and acute. I could go on and on about how it broke every negative expectation I had going into it.  So long story short is this: Don't be intimidated by it's archaic overtones; it's only a year old. Don't think this is a 'mash 'attack' to win JRPG'; it's more than that.  I'm just sucked into this simple little game. I'll update the review once I've played more.
This game is pretty damn good, I recommend getting it and trying it out, although it kinda sucks when you die as you have to start all over.
Pros - Everything you want in a text based game  Cons - Sometimes the game kills you off  ie. things start hitting for half your life and can't keep up heals  ie. blinded until the monster kills you

Excellent game. I'm just leaving a review to increase its +ranking, it deserves it. I'd write a longer review but currently extremely addicted. Might edit this next year when I've had enough of it, if that ever happens.

Do you like old school rpg feel? Do you like improving your character fast? Do you like serving patrons :^)(nobody likes but it gives money)?! Well this game is fro you. Important note: Very addicting!

this game is amazingly complex and brutal. normal mode alone was too much for me at first. getting a few hours into the game and coming up against an enemy who would crush me and end my campaign got extremely frustrating. but i kicked it down to easy and played it like a tutorial for a bit, learning a couple classes and the story and the massive amount of side content such as radiant side quests, or your house you can build/upgrade and dig for scrap/items. you can run your own tavern and build your relationship with different factions within the world. the ASCII graphics are also impressively detailed and the amount of depth they put into their combat system is impressive. this is easily the best text based game i've played. i have 17 hours in it and i don't have any idea where i'm at in the story with any of my characters, but i don't care. i'm having a blast levelling up and questing and exploring the 4-5 areas i've unlocked with them so far and finding a large variety of enemies/bosses/events/items. i'm hoping there's no level cap or the level cap is pretty high, because i love how many different things you can put points in when you level up. the class based skills, the general skills and weapon skills. you can become a specialized badass in just about anything. wanna be a mage who wields greatswords and/or bows instead of the classic staves/wands/daggers? you can. with the overwhelming amount of things there is to do and discover in this game, i don't have enough space in this review to list it all and i'm constantly finding more all the time.  the bottom line is, if you like text based games or wanna try a text based RPG, this is the best one i've found so far and i wholeheartedly recommend you try it out. wait for it to go on sale if you're worried about the $8 price tag, but i assure you there is easily a hundred hours worth of content to this game.

One playthrough, like it so far. Will update this review with details after I have more time in. Recommend it so far.   Edit: After more gameplay it is a loveletter to a long gone genre. It's well done and enjoyable, reminiscant of old school BBS door games like Legend of the Red Dragon.
Will 'A' again.
Im just in it for the sale badge, man
I was very happy about this purchase worth every moment its tribute to past rouge rpgs thanks for that classic feel i wanted

Totally overrated. And I love RPGs The graphics are nice and the combat is good, but the game is a total grindfest with permadeath. That means, you grind for 8 hours and die because you got bored in another battle and you have to start over. It gets old and boring very, very quick.
This game is boring as heck. Just idling for my cards now.
Hurts my eyes just looking at the screen. Doesn't matter how good the game is if I get dizzy looking at it.

One of the games on the humble bundle monthly game subscription this month, november 2015. It's trying hard to be a roguelike but it's failing miserably at it. Unless you love indie stuff cause indie hurr durr screw triple a bullcrap then this game isn't worth it.
This game is pretty great and plays pretty well.  up until an act 2 boss which is unbeatable.

I found the game completely not my style. It was hard to read the text without straining the eyes and the story was uninteresting. Music was pretty good though. Controls were fine, just too complex and a messy UI.
